Fix the board to the base with adhesive: Pick up IC1 with adhesive tape. Adhesive tape should cover only half of the IC;Then the IC can be aligned and fixed with adhesive tape;Alignment important: Small point on IC must match with point on board at top left;Solder all legs to the board with solder;Then the tape can be removed and the other side can be fixed
Solder resistors R1 to R6;To do this{
column3: } add solder to one pad;Then heat the solder and feed the resistor to the side with tweezers;Then solder the second pad

Fix the board to the base with adhesive: Solder capacitor C1 with the technique presented before

Attention! Alignment of the LEDs is important! First read all steps;Solder the LEDs the same way as the resistors;Turn the board over;The LEDs have a small green line on the top side; There are small arrows or small dots printed on the board; The arrows or dots on the board show the side{
column3: } where the small green line has to be;Tip: If the arrows or dots on the board are hard to see{
column4: } refer to the layout drawing on the last page of the manual

Fix the board to the base with adhesive: Schalter mit üblicher Technik auflöten;Ausrichtung ist egal
Solder on the switch with usual technique;orientation does not matter
Solder the battery holder;Turn over PCB;Battery holder and PCB have plus and minus symbol printed on them. This must match
Attention: Insert battery correctly! A metal pickup (see picture: left metal pickup) must grip on top of the battery;Switch on;Done!
